channel.title: Hello Linux server
channel.description: Hello how i can run server in linux (ubuntu 9.04)? i got in server the run.sh and compile.sh so ho can do a tuturial how to run a "runescape privat server on linux?"please

item.title: Hello Linux server
item.dc:creator: @shapaklekas shapaklekas
item.description:
@shapaklekas wrote:

Lol no but nice try in linux are 2file types (this time ho now is intresting) run.sh=run.bat or run=run.bat :)[br][br][size=1]Posted on: May 15, 2009, 06:30:46 am[/size][hr]So ho can help?? my run (not a run.sh) is

[code=php]#!/bin/bash

cd /home/karolis/Desktop/Shapaklekas/‘combattscape\ v3’/combattscape’s\ soucre/ && java -Xmx1024M server[/code] my compile is [code=perl]#!/bin/bash

Tested with: SuSE Linux 10.0

Requires java path be stored in $PATH

Usage:

Enter the following in terminal before first usage:

"chmod +x compile.sh && chmod +x run.sh

javac -classpath . -d /home/karolis/Desktop/Shapaklekas/‘combattscape\ v3’/combattscape’s\ soucre *.java -g

[/code][br][br][size=1]Posted on: May 15, 2009, 08:43:36 am[/size][hr]BUMP ho can help me??[br][br][size=1]Posted on: May 17, 2009, 12:53:28 pm[/size][hr]HELP PLS

Read full topic

item.title: Hello Linux server
item.dc:creator: @johno2 johno2
item.description:
@johno2 wrote:

Linux is a different OS, i was thinking if getting it. Ok, Shapeaklikas, im guessing Linux can’t understand the command in run.bat (Or what ever linux uses…) so it can’t find your folders, im not a wizz but im guessing linnux has there own version of a cfg file? Try searching this in google

what is linux version of a cfg file?

If you find an answer, just change the .cfg (by clicking save as) to what linux recognises?

I hope this helps, Johno

Read full topic

item.title: Hello Linux server
item.dc:creator: @Fat_Cookies Fat Cookies
item.description:
@Fat_Cookies wrote:

It simply means your config folder is not found. Get the source again and copy all the files into the folder and run again.

In think a tut for running a server on Linux is needed since all *NIX Operating Systems are superior to Windows for running a server in every way. That is a fact, anyone that disagrees is a troll.

Edit: I am now creating a “Running A Server on Linux” (On Ubuntu because most people dont like command line interface)

Read full topic

item.title: Hello Linux server
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

It sounds like he wants to run a runescape private server under linux. Good choice by the way, linux is much more stable and secure than windows.

With ubuntu, you need to run this command to install java:

sudo apt-get install sun-java6-jdk

Then simply compile your server with your compile.sh shell file and run it with your run.sh shell file (assuming they are correct).

Any questions?

Read full topic
